The Roger Federer shot that was so good it made Rafael Nadal laugh Published 24/7 
Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal have enjoyed some epic battles over the years and their rivalry - fiercely competitive but friendly - is considered by some as the greatest in tennis history. 
It was great to see them face off in the Australian Open final at the start of 2017. 
Federer and Nadal hadn’t gone head-to-head in a Grand Slam final since the 2011 French Open, so it felt like a bit of a throwback to yesteryear. Article continues below 
It was Federer who won the five-set battle, securing his 18th slam in the process. 
“Thank you Rafa,” Federer said after the match. “He said so many lovely things. Article continues below Roy Hodgson finally explains why he put Harry Kane on corners - makes it worse 
“I don't think that we could have thought when we were at his academy that we would be here in a final. 
“Tennis is a tough sport and we don't have draws but if I could have shared it today with Rafa I would have taken a draw. 
“Keep playing Rafa, please. Tennis needs you. Thank you for everything you do.” Such mutual respect between rivals is rare 
It’s terrific that two players who spent so long at the top, competing against one another, have such a strong mutual respect. 
Such a competitive rivalry usually results in jealousy, bitterness and rows - in all sports, not just in tennis - but that’s never really been the case between Federer and Nadal. 
Sure, there’s been the odd disagreement - such as when Federer criticised Nadal over his slow play at Wimbledon back in 2014 - but, by and large, they’ve got on well both on and off the court. Video: Nadal laughs at Federer's audacious shot 
A brilliant clip of their mutual respect has emerged from the 2011 Mubadala World Tennis Championship. 
After Federer pulled off one particularly outrageous shot, Nadal could help but laugh at his opponent’s talent and audacity. 
You can watch it here… 
We’ll all miss them both when they retire.
